channel.title: Evolution in civilized species
channel.description: Nvm, this wasnt meant as a rule to live by , just a discussion about if we are/arent stopping evolution in ourselves, i do not agree with whatever nazi ideology but you guys interpert this completely wrong, please remove

item.title: Evolution in civilized species
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“thepinksock, post:13, topic:351890”]What kind of society would we live in if we didn’t allow people who are different from us, or genetically inferior, to reproduce? I for one don’t want to go back to flinging poo like a monkey.

[/quote]SEIG HEIL! TOTEN DIE JUDISCHEN ABSCHAUM! LASSEN SIE DIE WELT DER ARISCHEN HERRENRASSE ZU GEHEN!

item.title: Evolution in civilized species
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

By keeping people (with birth defects who would die without medical assistance) alive and allowing them to “pollute” the gene pool, we could be changing evolution. But we wouldn’t be slowing it, just mutating it further. This isn’t necessarily a bad thing and even if it were, who’s cruel enough to let people die when we have the technology to keep them alive?

I guess a solution to this supposed problem would be to castrate anyone born with a severe disability although I’m guessing this would be a bad idea, people are disabled for a reason, diversity.

If you want to pursue this Nazi ideology then I suggest you go into Eugenics.

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution in civilized species
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

peterbjornx:

Genetically there is no competition anymore, for example a person with a genetic variant of diabetes has just as much chance of reproducing as a healty individual

Here in the rich world, but in other parts of the world it not the same chance, and with global warming things can change. I bet people with higher resistance to heat will have a higher survival rate than others.

Read full topic
